description: A full-sized polymer foregrip.  Allows for better handling of the firearm.  Has ribbed grooves on the front and the back, and two islands of rubber texture on the sides.

variants.description: A full-sized polymer foregrip with a textured rubber island.  Its purpose is to assist in handling one's firearm, while also retaining a small profile when installed.  The texture helps improve the degree of control, though its effect is limited by the small area.  <variant_black>

description: An angled metal foregrip with a skeletonized design.  Allows for better handling of the firearm.  Its somewhat-ergonomic design combined with its length make it a good choice for a foregrip.

variants.description: A skeletonized angled grip with a unique, aggressive design.  Its purpose is to assist in handling one's firearm, while also retaining a small profile when installed.  It doesn't offer as much control as a full-sized foregrip, but the overall effect is still better than not having any foregrip.  The finger shelf at the front help retain the grip, while the overall construction allows for decent control over recoil.  <variant_black>

description: A pair of tiny metal fingerstops, adjustable in position and length.  Allow for better handling of the firearm.  These don't offer a major improvement due to their miniature size, but they're still better than nothing.

name.str_pl: pairs of Strike Industries Bikini fingerstops

variants.description: A pair of tiny metal fingerstops, essentially the most minimal version of a foregrip.  The pair can be adjusted to perform a variety of specific tasks.  Their effect is minimal overall, but the benefit is that of a lower footprint and added weight.  These come in black.

description: A short metal foregrip.  Allows for better handling of the firearm.  Its hollow design make it ligther than the alternatives.  Deep grooves along the entire length offer a good grip.

variants.description: A short metal foregrip with deep grooves all the way along the length.  Its purpose is to assist in handling one's firearm, while also retaining a small profile when installed.  The hollow design makes it significantly-lighter than the alternatives.  <variant_black>

description: A compact metal handstop.  Allows for better handling of the firearm.  Textured, thus offering slightly better performance over its competitors of similar size.

variants.description: A tiny metal handstop with a barrier-style texture.  Its effect is minimal overall, but the benefit is that of a lower footprint and added weight.  <variant_black>

description: An angled foregrip with an exceptional amount of material removed.  Allows for better handling of the firearm.  Performs well against competition, while also saving on weight.

It doesn't offer as much control as a full-sized foregrip, but the overall effect is still better than not having any foregrip. description: A full-sized foregrip with notches at the bottom to prevent your hand from slipping.  Allows for better handling of the firearm.  This model is famous for being commonly used by U.S. soldiers.

variants.description: A full-sized polymer grip.  Its purpose is to assist in handling one's firearm, while also retaining a small profile when installed.  This model is famous for being part of SOPMOD: a set of rifle attachments supplied to the U.S. infantry.  It offers solid recoil control, with its length and shape assisting with handling.  The grooves at the bottom prevent the user's hand from slipping.  <variant_black>
